SEARCH
Package model

Class Reader

java.lang.Object
model.Reader
All Implemented Interfaces:
AddProduct
Direct Known Subclasses:
Premium, Regular
public abstract class Reader extends Object implements AddProduct
The Reader class contains information about a reader, including their name, ID, current and last session page, and the books and magazines they have access to.

    • setStartReadingPage

      public void setStartReadingPage(int productInt, int page)
      This Java function sets the start reading page of a bibliographic product in an ArrayList of books and magazines.
      Parameters:
      productInt - The index of the bibliographic product in the combined list of books and magazines.
      page - The page number where the user wants to start reading the selected bibliographic product.

    • getStartReadingPage

      public int getStartReadingPage(int productInt)
      This function returns the starting reading page of a bibliographic product based on its index in a combined list of books and magazines.
      Parameters:
      productInt - The index of the bibliographic product in the combined list of books and magazines.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the starting page of a bibliographic product (book or magazine) at the given index in the combined list of books and magazines.

      public ArrayList<BibliographicProduct> returnBibliographicProductsByDate()

      Returns:
      The user ArrayList of BibliographicProduct objects sorted by their publication date.

    • searchNumberBibliograpicProductReader

      public int searchNumberBibliograpicProductReader(String id)
      The function searches for a bibliographic product by its ID in a list of books and magazines and returns its position.
      Parameters:
      id - The parameter "id" is a String representing the unique identifier of a bibliographic product that needs to be searched for in the "books" and "magazines" ArrayLists.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the position of the BibliographicProduct with the given id in the combined ArrayList of books and magazines. If the product is not found, the method returns -1.

    • checkUserHaveAProduct

      public boolean checkUserHaveAProduct(BibliographicProduct product)
      The function checks if a given bibliographic product is present in the list of books or magazines.
      Parameters:
      product - BibliographicProduct object that represents a product (book or magazine) to be checked if it exists in the library's collection.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value which indicates whether the given BibliographicProduct object is present in the list of books or magazines. If the product is found in either of the lists, the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.

      public void setLastSessionPage(int lastSesionPage)
      This is a Java function that sets the value of a variable called "lastSessionPage".
      Parameters:
      lastSesionPage - The parameter `lastSesionPage` is an integer value representing the last page visited by a user in a session. The method `setLastSessionPage` sets the value of the instance variable `lastSessionPage` to the provided value.
